plugins.name: BSA
plugins.descr:
Core assets are provided as a BSA. The advantage is that loose files from other mods will always take priority, making sure that those mods can function correctly without managing load order manually. Note that optional custom textures and any meshes required by them will be still provided as loose files so that you can manage their priority appropriately.

Additionally, Particle Patch for ENB.esp plugin containing fixes to Fire FX shaders is installed.

plugins.name: Loose Files
plugins.descr: Core assets are provided as loose files instead of a BSA in case you want to manage their priority manually. Additionally, the Particle Patch for ENB.esp plugin containing fixes to Fire FX shaders is installed.

plugins.name: Yes
plugins.descr:
Light shafts can be controlled by [PARTICLE] settings of ENBSeries but as a downside they will appear slightly different, whether or not they look better or worse is subjective.

Example image with custom textures active.

plugins.name: No
plugins.descr:
Lights shafts are not modified anyhow and cannot be controlled with [PARTICLE] settings of ENBSeries so they may appear too bright depending on your preset and weather mod.

Example image with custom textures active.

plugins.name: Particle Light
plugins.descr:
Render glow as particle light.

In the preview image, before (vanilla) is on top and after is at bottom.

plugins.name: Remove
plugins.descr:
Remove glow completely.

In the preview image, before (vanilla) is on top and after is at bottom.

plugins.name: Yes
plugins.descr: Choose this if you want to install custom textures. Mostly these are improved (somewhat subjective, obviously), higher resolution textures for a number particle effects such as ambient fog, mist and light shafts but also custom 4K cobwebs and some other minor things. Custom textures always come as loose files.

plugins.name: Required Files
plugins.descr:
This is just a VERY HACKY compatibility patch thing to allow creature BEHAVIOUR edits with Nemesis,

This does not allow for creature sex animations mods from FNIS to work with Nemesis, that will require Nemesis 2(which is still being worked on) 

As more and more mods are coming out effecting creature's behaviours it just makes sense to have something like this instead of it being inside multiple mods

It also includes an optional behaviour patch for Tktk’s Ultimate combat, which allows the creatures to do their new attacks added by Ult combat(Needs you to have ultimate combat installed)

plugins.name: Introduction
plugins.descr:
Hello everybody, this mod is an skse plugin allowing more advanced physics interactions to be applied to actors via configuration files.

What's the difference with the HDT-SMP mod?
- The versions presented here massively improve performance over HDT-SMP. This makes a huge difference as it allows for things like animated guard capes, clothes, hair, etc. without breaking your FPS every time you approach a city or a group of imperials/stormcloaks.
- AE and VR versions are provided.
- Physics configuration can be modified during the game with papyrus scripts.
- Plugins applying other forces can be developed (magnetism, earthquakes, wind, star wars force, ...).

You still need to install HDT-SMP clothes, capes, hair, ....

Please endorse :)
Please provide videos with lots of NPCs with animated clothes, capes, hair, etc. :)

VR functionalities are added by alandtse.
Papyrus functionalities are added by SesamePaste.
Plugin functionalities are added by jg1.
Non-hookean physics functionalities are added by webspam.
Current active developers at the time of this writing, ordered by date of involvement in HDT-SMP: alandtse, DaydreamingDay, igloomod.

plugins.name: CUDA
plugins.descr:
Q: What is CUDA?
A: CUDA is a NVidia API enabling general purpose processing on the GPU. Useful when the GPU is powerful, the calculus are adapted for GPU, and the transfers between the CPU and GPU minimal.

If you wish CUDA GPU acceleration, CUDA must be enabled in the configs.xml file (you can use FSMPM - The FSMP MCM for this).
CUDA GPU acceleration is not yet enough optimized, so it is often slower than having CUDA disabled.

Moreover, it has been reported that the CUDA version of FSMP is not compatible with NVIDIA‘s Linux drivers.
If you use Linux, it is recommended you install the NOT CUDA version (thanks Vainly for this info).

plugins.name: NOT CUDA (recommended)
plugins.descr: Probably more stability and performance with this version rather than a CUDA version with the CUDA option disabled.

plugins.name: No AVX
plugins.descr:
If your CPU doesn't support the AVX instruction set, select this.

Q: What is AVX?
A: Advanced_Vector_Extensions are extensions to the instruction sets for microprocessors from AMD and Intel. All Intel CPUs starting with Sandy Bridge in 2011 and AMD processors on their "Bulldozer" architecture and beyond offer this set of instructions.

plugins.name: AVX (recommended)
plugins.descr:
If your CPU supports the AVX instruction set, select this.
Performance improvements over no AVX.

plugins.name: AVX2
plugins.descr:
If your CPU supports the AVX2 instructions set, select this.

Should bring performance improvements over AVX, but brings some synchronisation too, so may in some cases bring less performance than AVX.
Test and choose for yourself :)

idaan300 notes:
"All intel CPU's that support AVX2 (and the few that support AVX512) use instruction intrinsics to downclock themselves in order to prevent overheating. As soon as an intel CPU sees one AVX2/512 instruction it will downclock itself for the remainder of program execution because AVX uses a lot more of the CPU die and thus generates more heat in general. This downclocking will reduce performace across the whole game because as we all know skyrim loves single threaded performance thus potentialy negating any benefits of running this version of the dll.

AMD CPU's in comparison don't downclock themselves on AVX2 workloads (they only downclock based on current temperature) and thus perfomance can only be increased by using AVX2. Older Ryzen chips (before 3000) wont see any benefit to AVX2 instructions because they have to emulate it using standard AVX (the difference here is in instruction width, AVX2 has 256 bit wide registers and AVX 128 bit. Meaning AVX2 usualy can get double the amount of work done at the same time compared to standard AVX. Older zen chips emulate these wider registers but seeing as these are 128 bit it takes twice as long to execute them because the CPU can't fit the whole intended instruction in a given register thus negating any speed improvement AVX2 could add).

It's not recommended running this on Intel chips or anything older than AMD's ryzen 3000 but of course feel free to try it out and see if it works for you."

plugins.name: AVX512
plugins.descr:
NOT SUPPORTED ON INTEL CPU!!!
Do NOT come with a bug report concerning AVX512 if this bug doesn't happen with the AVX2 build, except if you come with the solution too.

"Intel does not officially support AVX-512 family of instructions on the Alder Lake microprocessors.
Intel has disabled in silicon (fused off) AVX-512 on recent steppings of Alder Lake microprocessors to prevent customers from enabling AVX-512.
In older Alder Lake family CPUs with some legacy combinations of BIOS and microcode revisions, it was possible to execute AVX-512 family instructions
when disabling all the efficiency cores which do not contain the silicon for AVX-512."

If your CPU supports the AVX512 instructions set, select this.

Should bring performance improvements over AVX2 and AVX, but brings some synchronisation too, so may in some cases bring less performance than AVX/AVX2.
Test and choose for yourself :)

plugins.name: Install FSMPM - The FSMP MCM (recommended)
plugins.descr:
Adds a configuration menu for FSMP
Uses an esl slot. You might not want to use an esl slot if you're on VR.
In that case, choose one of the options below.

plugins.name: No MCM - Extreme performance (recommended)
plugins.descr:
This is a configs.xml file optimized for performance over physics simulation quality.

You will see physics slowdowns under 60 fps.
Max wind distance is 2000.
Maximum 3 ms each frame are allocated to FSMP.
5 skeletons max are calculated at the same time.
Uses the RealTime clock instead of the WorldTime clock.
When you have at the same time smp hair and smp wig, now, only the wig is physically calculated.
Some more settings are defined into the file.

You can of course adapt it to your liking :)

It is fully commented, propositions of improvements are welcome.

NB from full_inu: if you wish to adapt the numIterations value, the lowest value 4 was found to cause glitches with collision bodies and provide an overall visible drop of quality of cloth physics.

plugins.name: No MCM - Reasonable configuration
plugins.descr:
This is a reasonable configs.xml file balancing performance and quality.

You will see physics slowdowns under 30 fps.
Max wind distance is 3000.
Maximum 5 ms each frame are allocated to FSMP.
10 skeletons max are calculated at the same time.
Uses the RealTime clock instead of the WorldTime clock.
When you have at the same time smp hair and smp wig, now, only the wig is physically calculated.
Some more settings are defined into the file.

You can of course adapt it to your liking :)

It is fully commented, propositions of improvements are welcome.

NB from full_inu: if you wish to adapt the numIterations value, the lowest value 4 was found to cause glitches with collision bodies and provide an overall visible drop of quality of cloth physics.

plugins.name: No MCM - Maximum compatibility
plugins.descr:
This is a configs.xml file optimized for maximum compatibility.

================================
You should use this config file when testing for bugs.
================================

You will see physics slowdowns under 20 fps.
Max wind distance is 4000.
Maximum 5 ms each frame are allocated to FSMP.
20 skeletons max are calculated at the same time.
Uses the RealTime clock instead of the WorldTime clock.
When you have at the same time smp hair and smp wig, both are physically calculated.
Log level Verbose.
Some more settings are defined into the file.

You can of course adapt it to your liking :)

It is fully commented, propositions of improvements are welcome.

plugins.name: No MCM - Extreme quality
plugins.descr:
THIS WILL DESTROY YOUR FPS!!

This is a configs.xml file optimized for physics simulation quality.

The physics is calculated twice as often (min-fps = 120).
You will see physics slowdowns under 30 fps.
Max wind distance is 4000.
Maximum 10 ms each frame are allocated to FSMP.
60 skeletons max are calculated at the same time.
Uses the RealTime clock instead of the WorldTime clock.
When you have at the same time smp hair and smp wig, both are physically calculated.
Some more settings are defined into the file.

You can of course adapt it to your liking :)

It is fully commented, propositions of improvements are welcome.

plugins.name: FSMPU - The FSMP User Guide.pdf
plugins.descr:
FSMPU - The FSMP User Guide will be installed in data\SKSE\Plugins\hdtSkinnedMeshConfigs\.

At the time I write these lines, FSMP has had 625.526 (update: 1,160,376 ) unique downloads since the 21st October 2021, which should mean 625.526 (update: 1,160,376) unique users in 1.5 (update: 2.5!) years.

Thank you 😊!

However, this has brought some very specific challenges, for example how to maintain a useful and up-to-date knowledge base in a thriving and diverse community.
This User guide aims to try and solve some of these challenges.
I hope to update it each time I see a way to save my time and your time.

plugins.name: hdtSMP64.xsd
plugins.descr:
The hdtSMP64.xsd file, which is the FSMP Validator, will be installed in data\SKSE\Plugins\hdtSkinnedMeshConfigs\.

This allows you to check the validity of your HDT-SMP XML bodies and outfits physics files while writing them.
It's NOT for the configs.xml file.
If you have problems with the physics of a specific mod using FSMP, the first step is to check the validity of its xml physics files.
								
It is maintained to be consistent with Faster HDT-SMP. It may still be consistent with the original HDT-SMP before FSMP 2.0.
								
Which setup?
								
You can use Visual Studio,
or you can use Visual Studio Code, with this free plugin from the marketplace: https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=redhat.vscode-xml
As the files in this mod aren't used by Skyrim, you can put them outside your mod folder if you wish.
								
How to use this validator?
In your xml file, set the initial system tag like this, with the correct path to where you have put the .xsd provided in this mod.
 system xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="FSMP-Validator" xsi:schemaLocation="FSMP-Validator ./hdtSMP64.xsd"
 You can set the whole path to hdtSMP64.xsd if you want, just remember to replace each space by "%20".
								
What is implemented?
- All the tags and attributes supported in Faster HDT-SMP
- Checks if you're using the right tags and attributes with the right spelling
- Checks if you're using the right data types
- Checks if a mandatory tag or attribute is provided
- Checks that names are unique when it's mandatory
- Checks that templates and extends refer to a declared name
- Provide documentation on numerous tags and attributes
								
What is not yet implemented?
- Checks that system is the root tag
- Comments for each tag and attribute

plugins.name: Thanks
plugins.descr:
Now, some last presents :)

- The discord server to discuss with the Faster HDT-SMP community: https://discord.gg/tvWRzcKPV3

Here are some recommended mods:

- SMP-NPC crash fix, https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/91616
Fixes a random crash when loading NPCs with SMP hair.
Thanks to jg1 :)

- CC Bone Colossus Skeleton Fix, https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/63167
To solve the infamous colossus bone bug
Thanks to Yanjding :)

- Clean up the physics outfit - Collision reset, https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/86845
Physics outfits are essential elements that add life to Skyrim. However, one inconvenience is that physics can break after dynamic movement. So this mod was born to solve it immersively.
Thanks to skypia :)

- Dynamic HDT - Papyrus Script Extension for Faster HDT-SMP, https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/63017
To be able to change the physics configuration at runtime, through papyrus
Thanks to SesamePaste :)

- HDT-SMP Force Fields, https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/79899
Allows spells and effects to interact with HDT-SMP. Fireballs will not only send cheese wedges flying, but also mess up your hair. Immersion!
Thanks to jg1 :)

- SMP Wind, https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/76776
Another implementation of wind.
Thanks to jg1 :)

Finally, credits and thanks to hydrogensaysHDT, aers, ousnius, Karonar1, alandtse, DaydreamingDay, igloomod, SesamePaste, jg1, antpillager, Acro, webspam and full_inu :)
Built from branch: https://github.com/DaymareOn/hdtSMP64/tree/test

plugins.name: Jorrvaskr Map Marker (Closed City)
plugins.descr: Adds a map marker to Jorrvaskr and a config to make it use the Companions marker. Also serves as a config setup example. This file has the map marker in the Whiterun worldspace for vanilla closed cities.

plugins.name: Jorrvaskr Map Marker (Open City)
plugins.descr: Adds a map marker to Jorrvaskr and a config to make it use the Companions marker. Also serves as a config setup example. This file has the map marker in the main Tamriel worldspace for mods that make cities open.

plugins.name: Ruined Map Markers Use Original Outline
plugins.descr: Gives "Ruined" map markers the full outlines of their non-ruined variants.

plugins.name: Altars and Shrines
plugins.descr: Applies the unused vanilla Altar marker (left in the image) for locations devoted to the Divines and the Shrine marker (right in the image) for locations devoted to Daedra.

plugins.name: Abandoned Mines Use Vanilla Design
plugins.descr: By default, CoMAP gives abandoned (i.e. non-friendly) mines a different marker design. Choosing this option will revert the design back to vanilla but retain the discovery sound.

plugins.name: Orc Only Bandit Locations Use Orc Stronghold Marker

plugins.name: Hearthfire (and Tundra Homestead) Uses Settlement
plugins.descr: Applies the Settlement marker to Heljarchen Hall, Lakeview Manor, Windstad Manor and Tundra Homestead.

plugins.name: Bruma - CoMAP Extension

plugins.name: Ayleid Ruins (BS to CoMAP)
plugins.descr: Restores the CoMAP Ayleid Ruins design.

plugins.name: Bruma Castle (BS to CoMAP) [Unique]
plugins.descr: Gives Castle Bruma its unique CoMAP design. This does not overwrite the Beyond Skyrim generic Castle design which would be used for all hold keep castles due to design slot limits without SKSE.

plugins.name: Bruma City (BS to CoMAP)
plugins.descr: Restores the CoMAP Bruma City design.

plugins.name: Minotaur Camp (BS to CoMAP)
plugins.descr: Restores the CoMAP Minotaur Camp design.

plugins.name: Morrowind Dwemer (BS to CoMAP)
plugins.descr: Restores the CoMAP Morrowind Dwemer design.

plugins.name: Redguard Ruin (CoMAP to BS)
plugins.descr: Swaps out the CoMAP Redguard Ruin design to use the Beyond Skyrim one instead.

plugins.name: 4K
plugins.descr: 4K textures for highest quality displacement. This install step determines the resolution of the core water assets that are used for tessellation and displacement. Higher resolution textures will yield smoother water animation and reduce jittering (pixelated noise when there's not enough resolution) but can cause reduced performance.

plugins.name: 2K
plugins.descr: 2K textures for best performance. This install step determines the resolution of the core water assets that are used for tessellation and displacement. Lower resolution textures will yield better performance at the cost of not as smooth water animation and introduction of some jittering.

plugins.name: Neutral

plugins.name: 4K

plugins.name: 2K

this improves the jiggle physics quality at the cost of performance.

the effect on performance is not sufficiently tested, and it might be negligible.

plugins.name: Lanterns Of Skyrim II
plugins.descr:
Lanterns of Skyrim II is a completely redesigned version of the old MannyGT LoS. This new edition includes many improvements and additions, more compatibility, improved light sources, vanilla exteriors lighting fixed bugs, snow-covered lighposts and lanterns in snowy areas for a more immersive experience, all lanterns are moved by the wind and much much more........
This new 4.0 version includes LoS II - Tamriel Master Lights.esp by default, this means that both plugins are merged into a single one.

plugins.name: LoS II - Lantern Workers Addon
plugins.descr: LoS II - Lantern Workers adds a lantern maintenance system. In each region there will be a workshop where lantern maintenance staff works. Lantern workers have scheduled tasks and real life for each day of the week and in addition to taking care of the various workshops, they will travel throughout Skyrim alone or escorted by one or two guards to check and repair lightposts. This first release includes the Solitude Workshop only but there are other new workshops ready to be implemented in the next releases of this addon. -Compatibility Note- LoS II - Lanterns Worker isn't compatible with Enhanced Solitude

plugins.name: README
plugins.descr: This mod allows you to eliminate NPC greetings altogether. Never will they bother you anymore from a mile away! This mod does affect the distance the NPC's will greet you from. This mod doesn't affect Encounters/Radiant Quests, NPC-to-NPC conversations, Commentaries from your follower, nor NPC's from being arrogant pricks when you do actually talk to them. The inspiration of this mod is from the mod of the same name, authored by Cipscis, from Oldrim / SLE.

plugins.name: No NPC Greetings
plugins.descr: Completely eliminates NPC greetings towards the player.

folders.src: 00 No NPC Greetings - No NPC Greetings

plugins.name: Reduced Distance (Recommended)
plugins.descr: Makes it so that the NPC should literally bump into you first or vice versa to greet you.

plugins.name: Slightly Reduced Distance
plugins.descr: More immersive, NPC's still greet you but at a closer distance compared to Vanilla.

folders.src: 02 No NPC Greetings - Slightly Reduced Distance

plugins.name: Slightly Reduced Distance xwize version
plugins.descr: More than Slightly Reduced Distance, but still less than Vanilla.

folders.src: 03 No NPC Greetings - Slightly Reduced Distance xwize version

isteps.name: Congratulations! You have finished installing No NPC Greetings.

plugins.name: Complete/Reviews
plugins.descr: Should you change your mind later, simply uninstall the mod. This does not contain nor affect any script whatsoever, and thus completely safe to install or uninstall in the middle of a playthrough.See the picture below for some early reviews of the mod!

plugins.name: Full install
plugins.descr: Full install. Candlelight, Magelight, carry torch and static mounted torches, braziers and campfires. Run the ENBLight Patcher script in zEdit after this install to fix overbright vanilla or mod lights, or use with a mod which allows adjusting light instensity. See Nexus mod page for details.

groups.name: Additional options - customize your install based on how much fps you can spare

plugins.name: Minor effects
plugins.descr: Minor effects like impact spark light and the Torchbug.

plugins.name: Extra light
plugins.descr: 3x light sources for Candlelight, Magelight and carry torch to cover a larger area. 4-5fps additional cost on 1080TI.

plugins.name: Magic hand effects
plugins.descr: Add lights to magic hand effects for almost all magic spells. Negligible to little fps cost. Adds variety to some fx for spells which share the same fx in vanilla (currently only for Fire spells).

plugins.name: Magic effects - Low-Moderate cost
plugins.descr: Add lights to magic effects for many spells. Fixes some vanilla effects which emit too much light. Details in article on Nexus mod page. Low-Moderate fps cost.

plugins.name: Magic weapon effects - fairly low cost
plugins.descr: Add lights to Bound weapons and the Draugr magic weapons from Labyrinthian. Fairly Low fps cost.

plugins.name: Fire magic projectiles - Low-Moderate cost
plugins.descr: Add lights to Flames, Firebolt, Fireball, Incinerate projectiles. Each projectile light ~= 1 torch light. DISABLE Complex Fire Lights to gain performance, my lights account for this.

plugins.name: Magic hazards and burning fires - Low to High cost
plugins.descr: Add lights to magic impacts and burning fires. FPS cost will vary from low to high depending on how many burning fires you have on screen. DISABLE Complex Fire Lights.

plugins.name: Magic effects - High cost
plugins.descr: Add lights to Fireball explosion, Flame Wall, Fire Storm, Lightning Storm, Blizzard, Bane of the Undead, Harmony, Mayhem, Unrelenting Force, Fire Breath, Frost Breath, Ice Form, Dismay, Disarm and Dragonrend shouts. DISABLE Complex Fire Lights.

plugins.name: Dragon fire
plugins.descr: Add lights to dragon fire. LOTS of light source particles. Dragon fire is very poorly animated in the game, so the lights may look weird at times but so does vanilla dragon fire. Dragon fire impacts/hazards are covered by fire hazard option so you want both for the full experience.

plugins.name: Extended
plugins.descr:
Extended installer

Allows to select all features and has full animation support.

See requirements on options or on modpage.

plugins.name: Basic
plugins.descr:
Basic installer

Installs a basic version of XPMS(S)E with full animation support.

Requires FNIS or Nemesis.

plugins.name: Minimal
plugins.descr:
Minimal installer

Installs a minimal version of XPMS(S)E with reduced animation support, which can lead to problems with phyiscs mods or animations mods combinations.

No requirements.

plugins.name: XPMS(S)E Latest
plugins.descr:
Latest XPMS(S)E animation rig map, with full support for all physics plugins body physics, such as HDT and CBP(C), supports the most up to date animations.

Requires FNIS or Nemesis

plugins.name: XPMS(S)E 4.51
plugins.descr:
Older XPMS(S)E animation rig map, with full support for all physics plugins body physics, such as HDT and CBP(C), some mod may require this older rig. 

Requires FNIS or Nemesis

plugins.name: XPMS(S)E TBBP
plugins.descr:
Legacy XPMS(S)E animation rig map, with support for body physics bundeled in animations, might conflict with physics plugins such as HDT and CBP(C), some animations.may require this. 

Requires FNIS or Nemesis

plugins.name: RaceMenu + XPMS(S)E MCM
plugins.descr:
Ingame Customizing with XPMS(S)E Racemenu Plugin and XPMS(S)E MCM for RaceMenu users.

Requires RaceMenu, SkyUI, SKSE and FNIS.

plugins.name: RaceMenu + XPMS(S)E MCM + Weapon Styles
plugins.descr:
Ingame Customizing with XPMS(S)E Racemenu Plugin and XPMS(S)E MCM for RaceMenu users.

Requires RaceMenu, SkyUI, SKSE and FNIS.

Weapon Styles by GiraPomba for changing equip animations. Style fitting animation options needs to be turned off in XPMS(S)E MCM.

plugins.name: RaceMenu
plugins.descr:
Ingame Customizing with XPMS(S)E Racemenu Plugin for RaceMenu users.

Requires RaceMenu

Weapons positions/animations not controlled by XPMS(S)E. needs other mods to replace that functionality.

plugins.name: XPMS(S)E MCM
plugins.descr:
Ingame Customizing with XPMS(S)E MCM for ECE/Vanilla users.

Requires SKEE from RaceMenu [SE/AE] or NetImmerse Override Standalone [LE], SkyUI, SKSE and FNIS.

plugins.name: XPMS(S)E MCM + Weapon Styles
plugins.descr:
Ingame Customizing with XPMS(S)E MCM for ECE/Vanilla users.

Requires SKEE from RaceMenu [SE/AE] or NetImmerse Override Standalone [LE], SkyUI, SKSE and FNIS.

Weapon Styles by GiraPomba for changing equip animations. Style fitting animation options needs to be turned off in XPMS(S)E MCM.

plugins.name: Continue
plugins.descr:
DEVIOUS DEVICES

A collection of adult gear and devices for the female adventurer.

Required for any mods that are part of the 'Devious Devices' mod family. Make sure to use the right mods for your game version, SE or AE. 

NOTE: Check on the sites below for GOG support. While DD has a DLL compatible with the GOG version of the game, there is no guarantee that the below requirements support GOG. 

SE/AE Requirements:
• SexLab: https://www.loverslab.com/files/file/20058-sexlab-se-sex-animation-framework-v164c-010722/
          • SexLab SE (game 1.5.97, SKSE 2.0.20): Use version 1.63
          • SexLab AE (game 1.6.353, SKSE 2.1.5), use version 1.64c
          • SexLab AE (game 1.6.640, SKSE 2.2.1/2.2.2/2.2.3), use version 1.65 or higher
• SexLab Aroused SE: https://www.loverslab.com/files/file/5482-sexlab-aroused-redux-sse-version-29/
• FNIS SE: https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/3038
• Racemenu: https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/19080
          • Racemenu SE (game 1.5.97, SKSE 2.0.20): Use version 4.16 from the old files
          • Racemenu AE (game 1.6.353, SKSE 2.1.5), use version 4.19.11
          • Racemenu AE (game 1.6.640, SKSE 2.2.1/2.2.2/2.2.3), version 4.19.13 or later (available on patreon only at the time of beta 8's release)
• BodySlide for CBBE/UNP compatible body: https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/201
          ONE of the following bodies and their requirements (variants like 3BA or BHUNP can be used as well):
          • CBBE SE - https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/198
          • UNP - https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/1699
• XP32 Maximum Skeleton Special Extended: https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/1988
• MFG Fix: https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/11669
          • MFG Fix SE (game 1.5.97, SKSE 2.0.20): Use version 1.54
          • MFG Fix AE (game 1.6.353, SKSE 2.1.5), use version 1.60
          • MFG Fix AE (game 1.6.640, SKSE 2.2.1/2.2.2/2.2.3), use version 1.6.1 or higher
• HDT SMP, one of the below versions. CPBC is not a replacement, but can be used alongside HDT SMP. If using AE, Faster HDT SMP is your only option.
          • HDT SMP (SE only): https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/30872
          • Faster HDT SMP (AE or SE, choose during install): https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/57339
• Address Library (Required for some of the mods listed above): https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/32444
          • Address Library SE (game 1.5.97, SKSE 2.0.20): Use version 2 of the 'All in One' package
          • Address Library AE (game 1.6.353+, SKSE 2.1.5+), use version 8 of the 'All in One' package

plugins.name: SunHelm
plugins.descr:
SunHelm Survival main mod.

SunHelm is a survival and needs mod that is lightweight and efficient, yet still boasts a full set of features.

SunHelm has integrated compatibility with many mods. However, there are some that still require a esp to patch. To check and see what mods have integrated support, please see the mod page.

plugins.name: Disable Cold
plugins.descr:
Disable Cold

This patch is meant for Frostfall or TFN users who do not want to use SunHelm's cold needs.

This plugin will toggle off cold needs completely, remove the MCM options for cold, and not allow Cold to start when starting the mod.

plugins.name: Campfire Skill Tree
plugins.descr:
This optional plugin adds a campfire skill tree to SunHelm. 

This plugin requires campfire to use.

plugins.name: Diseases
plugins.descr: This is an optional module that overhauls diseases. Please see the modpage for details.

plugins.name: SkyrimSE
plugins.descr:
Select this if you are using normal Skyrim Special Edition.



This version includes SkyUI - Survival Mode Integration (credit to GonDragon for permission to include this).

Therefore, there is no need to download this separately.

plugins.name: SkyrimVR
plugins.descr:
Select this option if you are using Skyrim VR. 

VR does not have some of the same engine support for warmth ratings that the normal Special Edition does.
This means I had to implement my own variation of warmth ratings.

For now, warmth ratings do not show in the UI, but you will be updated as to what your warmth rating is when armor is equipped and unequipped.

Using the Continuance power now also shows your total warmth rating.

Made by ALEXXiRAPTOR.

Also kudos to Simon Magus for his Discord, where I otherwise wouldn't have come across this patch.

plugins.name: Required
plugins.descr:
Themes decide who remains free or is enslaved. Free Women clothing is permissible for all. Slave clothing designates the wearer as a slave.

Clothing on neither list is subject to your mod configuration menu (MCM) strip settings. These clothes will be stripped from any slots you select. If that leaves a woman naked, men treat her as a slave. 

MCM options for giving sexy new outfits to NPCs, is also determined by your theme. It decides who gets an outfit and what the outfit is. 

Modders: Check the forums for instructions on how to build your own theme. It's simple if you use xEdit. Should you create a theme please share it in the forums. Perhaps it could be featured here.

plugins.name: SWR - Strong-Willed and Rich (Default)
plugins.descr:
Rules: Strong-Willed & Rich (SWR) ruleset. Roleplay friendly. Permits women who appear skilled in combat to walk free. Distinguishs between highborn females and commoners. Rich women also remain free and keep their clothes.

Apply Outfits MCM: Strips a free female of all clothes and leaves her naked. She will still be free, butt naked.

plugins.name: Luxury Collection
plugins.descr:
Rules: Roughly 75 percent of women will remain free. Mostly the wealthy women and merchants.

Apply Outfits MCM: Women will be required to purchase and wear clothes from the Luxury Collection. Those who can't afford these will be enslaved.

Requires the Luxury Collection mod. Adds EnforcerOutfitsLuxuryCollection.esp (flagged as .esl) which must be activated alongside the Luxury Collection.esp.

plugins.name: Enslave Everyone
plugins.descr:
Rules: No clothes are appropriate for Free females. Use  MCM stripping options to decide which clothing slots will be stripped. Theme effectively disables Free Woman functionality for NPCs.

Apply Outfits MCM: Not applicable. Only the Slaves Outfit can be applied.

plugins.name: Compatibility - Zaz Animation Pack (Default)
plugins.descr:
Rules: Broad compatibility with mods that add slave clothing. Including Devious Devices and Zaz Animation Pack. All items tagged with SexLabNoStrip or zbfWornDevice are considered slave clothing.

Apply Outfits MCM: Enslaved women are given a collar and cuffs from the Zaz Animation Pack.

Adds EnforcerOutfitsZAP.esp (flagged as .esl)

Credit to the ZAP team for all of these clothes.

plugins.name: Compatibility - Devious Devices + ZAP (Non-DD)
plugins.descr:
Rules: Broad compatibility with mods that add slave clothing.

Apply Outfits MCM: Enslaved women are given a random but themed set of devices from the ZAP and DD mods. These look like the ordinary article but do not slow down your game with scripts. Omits armbinders.

Adds Non-Devious Devices.esp and Non-Devious Devices - Masterlist.esp (both flagged as .esl) Also some optional patches that can be installed on the next page to remove items you do not want. These are all version 2022-11-22 of Corsec's Non-DD patch.

Credit to @Corsec for this theme, the Devious Devices team and Zaz Animation Pack for the clothes.

plugins.name: Compatibility - Devious Devices (Non-DD Old)
plugins.descr:
Rules: Broad compatibility with mods that add slave clothing.

Apply Outfits MCM: Enslaved women are given a set of "Non-Devious Devices". These look like ordinary DD equipment but do not slow down your game with scripts. Omits armbinders and gags.

Adds Non-Devious Devices Masterlist.esp (flagged as .esl) Also some optional patches that can be installed on the next page.

Contains the final version of Corsec's older "Master list" that was focused only on Devious Devices. As of November 2022 he has published a newer list. It mixes and matches ZAP and DD items that are free from scripts and is called the "Devious Devices + ZAP (Non-DD)" theme.

Credit to @Corsec for this theme, and the Devious Devices team for the clothes.

plugins.name: Compatibility - Devious Devices (Basic)
plugins.descr:
Rules: Broad compatibility with mods that add slave clothing.

Apply Outfits MCM: Enslaved women are given a Devious Devices collar. Randomly also gives Devious cuffs, gloves, piercings, corsets, harness, blindfolds, and ankle irons.

Credit to the entire Devious Devices team for these clothes.

Requires: 

- Faster SMP with autoAdjustMaxSkeletons set to true 	  https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/57339 

- KS Hairdos - HDT SMP with wigs selected during mod installation  	  https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/31300 

WARNING: These wigs use SMP so they sway in the wind and collide realistically. This can murder your FPS in enslaved cities if your CPU is not capable of processing the extra physics simulations. You need Faster SMP to run this plugin, do not use the abandoned regular SMP version. After installing that mod modify the FSMP configs.xml and set autoAdjustMaxSkeletons to true. With the correct configuration you can maintain 60+ FPS with this enabled. But you will need a mid-high end CPU. 

Giving every woman SMP hair increases SMP load. This does not increase script load. Only SMP. If your CPU can handle it you will experience no issues. If your CPU can almost handle it try tuning the FSMP configs.xml.

plugins.name: 60 fps
plugins.descr:
This will install CBPConfig file with timeStep set to 0.80

If you play at a different fps, calculate yours by dividing 48 by YOUR FPS. For example, 90 would be, 48/90 = 0.53

Set .timeStep values to 0.53 in CBPConfig.txt file.

Just choose one of them if you are going to use 3BA or BHUNP or similar because the file will be overwritten anyway.

Also, if you set FpsCorrection to 1 in CBPCSystem.ini file, you don't need to adjust this value.

plugins.name: 120 fps
plugins.descr:
This will install CBPConfig file with timeStep set to 0.40

If you play at a different fps, calculate yours by dividing 48 by YOUR FPS. For example, 90 would be, 48/90 = 0.53

Set .timeStep values to 0.53 in CBPConfig.txt file.

Just choose one of them if you are going to use 3BA or BHUNP or similar because the file will be overwritten anyway.

Also, if you set FpsCorrection to 1 in CBPCSystem.ini file, you don't need to adjust this value.

plugins.name: Install Gravity Config
plugins.descr:
This installs CBPConfig_Gravity.txt which includes gravity related options for bounce config.

Note that this causes your breasts to sag, so if you have an already saggy breast shape designed in bodyslide, this would make it more saggy. So use this only if you have a shape that is not designed to appear saggy already.
